POR.content: protocols of vigilance for new Aufklärung: beware the abysses and gorges, but also the bridges & barriers, beware of opening university to bottomless outside or closing it in on itself so that it is available to any interest, or becomes useless > beware of ends, university w/out ends?
POR.linkedContent: protocols of vigilance for new Aufklärung: beware the abysses and gorges, but also the bridges & barriers, beware of opening university to bottomless outside or closing it in on itself so that it is available to any interest, or becomes useless > beware of ends, university w/out ends?

PF.content: sometimes “outside” more faithful to principle of university than “inside”

UWC.content: unconditional university via Humanities (not so as to enclose itself there) > find best access to new public space, techniques, archive
UWC.linkedContent: unconditional university via Humanities (not so as to enclose itself there) > find best access to new public space, techniques, archive

UWC.content: university w/out conditions does not, in fact, exist > still, in principle, it remains ultimate place of critical resistance to dogmatism, unjust appropriation
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out conditions does not, in fact, exist > still, in principle, it remains ultimate place of critical resistance to dogmatism, unjust appropriation

UWC.content: right to deconstruction as unconditional right to ask questions—even re: the authority of the question, the interrogative form
UWC.linkedContent: right to deconstruction as unconditional right to ask questions—even re: the authority of the question, the interrogative form

UWC.content: unconditional university, resistance to indivisible sovereignty, to nation-state, to economic, media, ideological, cultural, religious powers > all that limit democracy to-come
UWC.linkedContent: unconditional university, resistance to indivisible sovereignty, to nation-state, to economic, media, ideological, cultural, religious powers > all that limit democracy to-come

UWC.content: university w/out condition: heterogenous to power > has no power of its own, “w/out condition” as in “w/out power,” “w/out defense” > can be held hostage (by science–capital)
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out condition: heterogenous to power > has no power of its own, “w/out condition” as in “w/out power,” “w/out defense” > can be held hostage (by science–capital)

UWC.content: deconstruct unconditional sovereignty: even the people, the citizen, the subject
UWC.linkedContent: deconstruct unconditional sovereignty: even the people, the citizen, the subject

UWC.content: must still conserve university’s particular sovereignty
UWC.linkedContent: must still conserve university’s particular sovereignty

UWC.content: principle of unconditionality: right to say everything, not limited to Humanities, but presents itself, originally, there, place of safekeeping
UWC.linkedContent: principle of unconditionality: right to say everything, not limited to Humanities, but presents itself, originally, there, place of safekeeping

UWC.content: deconstruction has privileged place in Humanities, place of irredentist resistance > principle of civil disobedience, dissidence in name of law above laws, justice of thought
UWC.linkedContent: deconstruction has privileged place in Humanities, place of irredentist resistance > principle of civil disobedience, dissidence in name of law above laws, justice of thought

UWC.content: thought: that which commands resistance
UWC.linkedContent: thought: that which commands resistance

UWC.content: deconstruct all determined figures sovereignty has taken throughout history
UWC.linkedContent: deconstruct all determined figures sovereignty has taken throughout history

UWC.content: university w/out conditions as a promise, pledge, a profession of faith
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out conditions as a promise, pledge, a profession of faith

UWC.content: “as,” “as if,” politics of the virtual (not a virtual politics) in cyberworld or cyberspace of worldwide-ization > delocalizing, virtualization of communication, publication, archivization
UWC.linkedContent: “as,” “as if,” politics of the virtual (not a virtual politics) in cyberworld or cyberspace of worldwide-ization > delocalizing, virtualization of communication, publication, archivization

UWC.content: where there’s trace there’s some virtualization (i.e. virtualization not absolutely novel)
UWC.linkedContent: where there’s trace there’s some virtualization (i.e. virtualization not absolutely novel)

UWC.content: new technical “stage” of virtualization > the accelerated rhythm/extent/power of capitalization of such virtuality: digitalization, computerization, virtually immediate mondialisation of readability destabilize university habitat, topology of event no longer “campus”
UWC.linkedContent: new technical “stage” of virtualization > the accelerated rhythm/extent/power of capitalization of such virtuality: digitalization, computerization, virtually immediate mondialisation of readability destabilize university habitat, topology of event no longer “campus”

UWC.content: impossible attempt to link “as if” to thinking of event: what happens when “taking place” of le travail, when the place itself, becomes virtual, becomes subject to mode “as if”?
UWC.linkedContent: impossible attempt to link “as if” to thinking of event: what happens when “taking place” of le travail, when the place itself, becomes virtual, becomes subject to mode “as if”?

UWC.content: professor: profession of faith, who will profess in the future? “to make profession of”: promise, declare openly, pledge, engage > exceeds pure techno-scientific knowledge (constative)
UWC.linkedContent: professor: profession of faith, who will profess in the future? “to make profession of”: promise, declare openly, pledge, engage > exceeds pure techno-scientific knowledge (constative)

UWC.content: bear witness: neither practice nor theory; profession, performative, “as if,” fable [etymology of “to speak” fari/phanai]
UWC.linkedContent: bear witness: neither practice nor theory; profession, performative, “as if,” fable [etymology of “to speak” fari/phanai]

UWC.content: work of a worker (travailleur) must be recognized as craft/trade/profession in market (a semantics rooted in socio-ideological history dating back to Christian Middle Ages) > when is there an oeuvre? professor’s authority not based on production of oeuvre
UWC.linkedContent: work of a worker (travailleur) must be recognized as craft/trade/profession in market (a semantics rooted in socio-ideological history dating back to Christian Middle Ages) > when is there an oeuvre? professor’s authority not based on production of oeuvre

UWC.content: not every travail an event in itself, doesn’t always produce an oeuvre, not every performative (always authorized by an institutional “as if”) produces oeuvre
UWC.linkedContent: not every travail an event in itself, doesn’t always produce an oeuvre, not every performative (always authorized by an institutional “as if”) produces oeuvre

UWC.content: act of professing a doctrine is performative, but doctrine is not
UWC.linkedContent: act of professing a doctrine is performative, but doctrine is not

UWC.content: Kant sees philosophy (in university) neither as performative nor as producing oeuvre, but professor of philosophy has total freedom > speaks publicly, but only inside university
UWC.linkedContent: Kant sees philosophy (in university) neither as performative nor as producing oeuvre, but professor of philosophy has total freedom > speaks publicly, but only inside university

UWC.content: transformation of cyberspace, beyond nation-state borders—renders inside of university even more unimaginable
UWC.linkedContent: transformation of cyberspace, beyond nation-state borders—renders inside of university even more unimaginable

UWC.content: absolute immunity of academic type must be protected even if it risks dangerous auto-immunity, even if we must address ourselves to university’s outside > we must commit ourselves in act, in work, in what we make happen w/ events
UWC.linkedContent: absolute immunity of academic type must be protected even if it risks dangerous auto-immunity, even if we must address ourselves to university’s outside > we must commit ourselves in act, in work, in what we make happen w/ events

UWC.content: techno-scientific virtualization of work, the putting-into-common, any “community” [Aristotle’s city] > mutation of taking place of event, of oeuvre—that which arrives
UWC.linkedContent: techno-scientific virtualization of work, the putting-into-common, any “community” [Aristotle’s city] > mutation of taking place of event, of oeuvre—that which arrives

UWC.content: humanities to come will cross disciplinary borders (not “interdisciplinary” or “cultural studies”)
UWC.linkedContent: humanities to come will cross disciplinary borders (not “interdisciplinary” or “cultural studies”)

UWC.content: humanities of tomorrow will have to study history of concepts that institute disciplines
UWC.linkedContent: humanities of tomorrow will have to study history of concepts that institute disciplines

UWC.content: Nietzsche’s promising animal (the figure of man) is still to-come
UWC.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s promising animal (the figure of man) is still to-come

UWC.content: “literature,” its link to performative force of “as if,” to the right to say everything (or not to say everything), which founds both democracy & unconditional sovereignty claimed by Humanities
UWC.linkedContent: “literature,” its link to performative force of “as if,” to the right to say everything (or not to say everything), which founds both democracy & unconditional sovereignty claimed by Humanities

UWC.content: end of certain figure of professor gives rise to other strategies of “as if,” singular oeuvres > Derrida believes in certain necessity of professoriat
UWC.linkedContent: end of certain figure of professor gives rise to other strategies of “as if,” singular oeuvres > Derrida believes in certain necessity of professoriat

UWC.content: mise en oeuvre (the putting to work), at least to the performative putting to work of “as if”
UWC.linkedContent: mise en oeuvre (the putting to work), at least to the performative putting to work of “as if”

UWC.content: necessary to dissociate unconditional independence (of thought, deconstruction, Humanities, justice) from any phantasm of indivisible sovereignty (mastery)
UWC.linkedContent: necessary to dissociate unconditional independence (of thought, deconstruction, Humanities, justice) from any phantasm of indivisible sovereignty (mastery)

UWC.content: sovereign mastery of interior > [indivisible] border of inside/outside vs. divisible limit, because divisible, it has a history > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the perhaps
UWC.linkedContent: sovereign mastery of interior > [indivisible] border of inside/outside vs. divisible limit, because divisible, it has a history > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the perhaps

UWC.content: university w/out conditions: “everywhere that it, perhaps, gives one (itself) to think”
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out conditions: “everywhere that it, perhaps, gives one (itself) to think”

UWC.content: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees
UWC.linkedContent: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees

UWC.content: take your time, but be quick: don’t know what awaits you
UWC.linkedContent: take your time, but be quick: don’t know what awaits you

EU.content: [vis-à-vis Schelling] art can never be limited/programmed by State, there is no State culture > philosophy, which demands unconditional freedom, should reside in Faculty of Arts
EU.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Schelling] art can never be limited/programmed by State, there is no State culture > philosophy, which demands unconditional freedom, should reside in Faculty of Arts

EU.content: bureaucratic organization doesn’t provide for philosophy, has ceased being a free association in view of the arts (poetic translation)
EU.linkedContent: bureaucratic organization doesn’t provide for philosophy, has ceased being a free association in view of the arts (poetic translation)

EU.content: though CIPH is Schellingian as a place reserved for problematic of translation, it has an anti-Schellingian angle: State can recover all its power if uni-formation is blindly trusted
EU.linkedContent: though CIPH is Schellingian as a place reserved for problematic of translation, it has an anti-Schellingian angle: State can recover all its power if uni-formation is blindly trusted

EU.content: for Kant, parasite could be contained to a margin of university > today, university is what has become its margin
EU.linkedContent: for Kant, parasite could be contained to a margin of university > today, university is what has become its margin

EU.content: university as a child of metaphysics & tehnē > once this offspring exceeds places assigned to it, becomes invasive margin: university “idea” reigns everywhere
EU.linkedContent: university as a child of metaphysics & tehnē > once this offspring exceeds places assigned to it, becomes invasive margin: university “idea” reigns everywhere

EU.content: parasite everywhere there’s language, public, publishing > to wish to control/exclude parasites is a misunderstanding of speech acts
EU.linkedContent: parasite everywhere there’s language, public, publishing > to wish to control/exclude parasites is a misunderstanding of speech acts
